For more passwords, information, hints and more please also ready my FAQ/strategy guide on GameFAQs:
https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/gba/178960-dune-ornithopter-assault/faqs/76383

In 2002, Cryo Interactive released their last game in the "DUNE" franchise: the 3rd-person action adventure game "Frank Herbert's DUNE" for the PC and the PS2. While that game was in development, Cryo Interactive also wanted to release a 3D flight simulator under the "DUNE" name. They hired the Hungarian development team Soft Brigade to create an Ornithopter game for the Game Boy Advance. Development started in 2001.

In Summer of 2002, a few months after Cryo's "Frank Herbert's DUNE" PC/PS2 game turned out to be a huge flop, Cryo Interactive went bankrupt. Soft Brigade's "Frank Herbert's DUNE: Ornithopter Assault" was basically completed, only lacking the announced multiplayer mode, but due to Cryo being bankrupt, the game was never submitted to Nintendo.

On March 22nd 2015, the website unseen64 (known for documenting, preserving and sometimes sharing cancelled and unreleased games) shared the ROM file of "Frank Herbert's DUNE: Ornithopter Assault".

Here's a link to the entry for the game on unseen64:
https://www.unseen64.net/2015/03/23/frank-herberts-dune-ornithopter-assault-gba-cancelled
